parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Plural
Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To speak allegorically. From allos and agoreo (compare agora); to allegorize.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
Sinai, a mountain in Arabia. Of Hebrew origin; Sina, a mountain in Arabia.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Hagar, the servant of Sarah, concubine of Abraham. Of Hebrew origin; Hagar, the concubine of Abraham.
